ProjectTitle: Emotion dysfunction in children with ADHD: a cross-cultural investigation
InitialFeedbackHistory:
13/02/2025
Storage/Preservation: you indicate using the J and I drive which are both good solutions, however you also mention OneDrive in the answers to some of the subsequent questions, please note that the ICTS recommends not to use OneDrive for research data. For data preservation you can also consider using the more economical K drive, for more information consult the storage guide.https://icts.kuleuven.be/storagewijzer/en
Sharing: great that you are considering to share your dataset in the future, but please be aware that you can only share your data as open data with a CC-BY license if you are sure that it is fully anonymous, if data is pseudonymous, i.e. if there is still a (small) possibility that the participants could be reidentified by you or by others, you can use RDR and apply access restrictions, interested researchers will see the description of your dataset, but have to submit a request to access the files upon signing a Data Transfer Agreement. For more information see https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr
label: good with suggestions
